item.title: Jane add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Secrets have power. And that power diminishes when they are shared, so they are best kept and kept well. Sharing secrets, real secrets, important ones, with even one other person, will change them. Writing them down is worse, because who can tell how many eyes might see them inscribed on paper, no matter how careful you might be with it. So it's really best to keep your secrets when you have them, for their own good, as well as yours." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The most difficult thing to read is time. Maybe because it changes so many things." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You think, as you walk away from Le Cirque des Rêves and into the creeping dawn, that you felt more awake within the confines of the circus. You are no longer quite certain which side of the fence is the dream." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description:
"I'm in love with you," he said quietly.
"Augustus," I said.
"I am," he said. He was staring at me, and I could see the corners of his eyes crinkling. "I'm in love with you, and I'm not in the business of denying myself the simple pleasure of saying true things. I'm in love with you, and I know that love is just a shout into the void, and that oblivion is inevitable, and that we're all doomed and that there will come a day when all our labor has been returned to dust, and I know the sun will swallow the only earth we'll ever have, and I am in love with you." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When adults say, "Teenagers think they are invincible" with that sly, stupid smile on their faces, they don't know how right they are. We need never be hopeless, because we can never be irreparably broken. We think that we are invincible because we are. We cannot be born, and we cannot die. Like all energy, we can only change shapes and sizes and manifestations. They forget that when they get old. They get scared of losing and failing. But that part of us greater than the sum of our parts cannot begin and cannot end, and so it cannot fail." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a slut time is. She screws everybody." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Thomas Edison's last words were 'It's very beautiful over there'. I don't know where there is, but I believe it's somewhere, and I hope it's beautiful." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was a hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You can love someone so much...But you can never love people as much as you can miss them." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The marks humans leave are too often scars." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting." -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?" -- John Green

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Green
Jane add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Grief does not change you, Hazel. It reveals you." -- John Green
